pullRequest.title: Correct introspect version
pullRequest.bodyText:
The value of introspectVersion used to trigger an introspect is now recorded as a label on the introspector CM to preserve the desire for a new introspection across operator restarts.


Added to the REST API:
A POST to /operator/v1/domains/{uid} may have one of the following values:
{ "action" : "INTROSPECT"} to trigger an introspection on domain {uid}
{ "action" : "RESTART"} to trigger a full restart of the domain


It does so by updating the introspectVersion or restartVersion fields of the domain, which the operator can then detect.

Changed the order of the checkstyle and spotbugs executions, as errors in the former seem to be more common causes of build failure.

commit.message: use label on introspector config map to track previous introspectVersion value
Add REST functionality for introspectDomain and restartDomain

nodes.bodyText: This is an odd edit to this Javadoc. A mistake?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -68,7 +82,6 @@
    * @param accessToken is the access token of the Kubernetes service account of the client calling
    *     the WebLogic operator REST api.
    * @param targetNamespaces a list of Kubernetes namepaces that contain domains that the WebLogic
-   *     operator manages.

nodes.bodyText: Not a big deal and we're grouping config map messages together but should we move this down to the end for the sake of ordering?
